text: 2 tubes cinnamon roll, refrigerated, with icing
16 ounces TACO BELL® Thick & Chunky Salsa
1 cup Knudsen Light Sour Cream (or BREAKSTONE'S Reduced Fat)
2 tablespoons seeds (chia, these are optional, I just love the texture they give)
1/2 cup brown rice syrup (honey works too!)
2 tablespoons coconut oil (melted, + more for cooking)
2 cups raspberry sorbet (I used President's Choice fat free raspberry gelato and it worked great) or 2 cups sherbet (I used President's Choice fat free raspberry gelato and it worked great)
1 cup blood orange juice, squeezed with pulp
3 tablespoons cake mix (regular or sugar free)
12 ounces salad (jar Aldi artichoke, or other brand equivalent)
1 cup baby spinach (densely packed fresh, chopped)
6 ounces low-sodium tuna in water (1 can)
2 tablespoons light mayonnaise (optional) or 2 tablespoons mustard (optional)
28 ounces tomatillos (can Whole, suggest La Costena brand)
1/2 cup sugar (may use 1/3 cup if you want it less sweet)
3 tablespoons of sauerkraut with caraway seeds
3/4 cup potato (or a little less, cooked water / plain water)
4 tablespoons French vanilla flavored coffee creamer (liquid)
1/2 cup organic cane sugar (plus more for dusting, optional)
2 cups salted butter (cold and cut into pieces)
2 cups all purpose flour (can substitute half bread flour)
2 -4 tablespoons honey or 2 -4 tablespoons granulated sugar
3 cups frozen blackberries (or peaches or canned apple pie filling, etc.)
4 ounces sliced reduced-fat swiss cheese (1-ounce slices)
3 cups broth (from cooked pork roast or chicken broth, divided)
1/2 cup red chile sauce (only add if making red chile pork tamales)
1/4 cup I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread
2 cups assorted fresh vegetables ((such as onion, bell pepper, broccoli florets and asparagus))
1/4 cup chicken broth (or dry white wine)
4 cups russet potatoes (peeled and thinly sliced, about 1-1/4 pounds)
1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (or more to taste)
2 tablespoons milk (double/heavy cream whole, is ok if you haven't got any cream)
1 cup butter (real, no substitutions! at room temperature)
3 cups flour (lightly spooned into measuring cups and leveled, don’t scoop it!)
1 cup cheese (grano padano, or parmigiano reggiano cheese, grated)
2 ounces semisweet chocolate (or bittersweet, finely chopped)
4 cups milk, to prepare pudding mix (or as directed on mix)
12 ounces seltzer water (Original, or Club Soda)
2 cups rice (any rice will do, just not instant)
8 ounces dried pasta (egg noodles or fettuccine)
1 cup chicken (fresh or frozen precooked, dice into ¼" squares, then measure)
2 cups milk (heavy cream, whole, will work too, it just won't be as creamy You can also make this paleo by subbing full fat coconut milk for the whole milk)
1/2 cup sweetener (choice, I prefer honey or honey granules)
1/3 cup shredded Italian cheese (or 3 thin slices fresh mozzarella cheese)
3 cups flour (sifted, cake or pastry flour works best since they’re softer)
4 tablespoons sugar (depending on how sweet you want it – or omit it all together)
1 cup raisins (leave these out for a more traditional soda bread)
2 teaspoons agave nectar (or other sweetener, to taste)
8 ounces regular hot cocoa, your favorite kind prepared
6 ounces reduced fat graham cracker crust
1/4 cup soy sauce (I use low sodium)
2 tablespoons Kahlua or 2 tablespoons kahlua-flavored syrup
1 cup English toffee bits or 1 cup Heath candy bar
3/4 cup vanilla almond milk (or milk of your choice)
2 tablespoons chocolate (or vanilla protein powder, optional)
1 cup water (2 cups for 8 qt pot)
2 tablespoons fresh basil, chopped or 2 teaspoons dried basil
3 ounces gin (good-quality, or vodka, your choice*)
2 cups milk (actually nut milk ~ see separate recipe)
2 tablespoons sugar or 2 tablespoons Splenda sugar substitute
2 teaspoons vanilla extract (or vanilla bean paste)
12 pieces bacon (fried crisp and cut in half)
1 cup cheddar cheese, grated (or your favourite kind)
20 ounces pineapple slices (in juice, drained, juice reserved)
2 tablespoons corn oil (plus a 5-second squirt of non-stick spray for emulsification purposes)
2 ounces heavy cream or 2 ounces half-and-half
5 tablespoons fry mix (Dunn's River Hot & Spicy Jerk Chicken)
1/2 cup TACO BELL Thick & Chunky Mild Salsa
1 cup KRAFT Mexican Style Finely Shredded Four Cheese
2 cups shredded cheese (I used cheddar, asiago, and pepperjack!)
6 ounces semisweet chocolate (or bittersweet, for dipping)
3 tablespoons butter (honey Sriracha, at room temperature)
8 ounces dough (Pillsbury crescent roll, I like to use the Crescent Dough Sheets, which don’t have any perforations)
1 cup salsa (can substitute with barbecue sauce)
1 cup grated cheddar cheese (I used 2% cheese, but any variety will work)
4 cups greens (i use a mix of baby kale, baby swiss chard, and spinach)
2 teaspoons sugar or 2 teaspoons powdered sugar
3 ounces sea salt (“Bolivian Rose” or “Sel Gris” work great)
1/2 cup passionfruit pulp (6 to 8 passion fruit)
2 tablespoons cane sugar (or other sweetener, plus more to taste)
1 cup frozen spinach (thawed and drained well.)
1/2 cup corn syrup (golden, if not use the transparent one)
2 cups French bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
4 teaspoons fat-free thousand island salad dressing
14 ounces sweetened flaked coconut (package of, Will use MOST of the bag, or maybe all)
6 ounces Stove Top Chicken Stuffing Mix
2 tablespoons plain soy yogurt (or plain yogurt or vanilla yogurt)
3 cups favorite pasta sauce (can use more, my pasta sauce Kittencal's Italian Tomato Pasta Sauce and Parmesan Meatballs works well for this)
15 ounces pitted dark cherries in juice
4 ounces mexican chocolate (3 ounces semi-sweet chocolate)
72 ounces jelly (Ball canning, jars with lids and rings)
1 cup balsamic vinaigrette (I used Kraft light version)
1/2 cup barbecue sauce (Cook'n'Shoup Bold n Tangy)
1/2 cup whole almonds (SimplyNature Organic, or Southern Grove Whole Almonds)
1 cup uncooked oatmeal or 1 cup uncooked oatmeal, with flax seed and wheat bran combination
2 cups chocolate chips (340 grams, 1 bag semi-sweet, or chopped chocolate)
30 -34 ounces of your favorite prepared marinara sauce or 30 -34 ounces tomato sauce
1/4 cup cocoa powder (and extra to dust the truffles)
11 ounces wafer cookies (Nilla, crushed, about 2 cups crushed)
2 teaspoons fresh basil, chopped (or 1/2 tsp dried)
1/4 cup dried fruit (unsweetened, cranberries, raisins, chopped apricots)
1 cup coconut milk, or more to taste
1 cup mixed berries, or more to taste
4 cups all purpose gluten free flour
9 ounces dark chocolate (255 g | 1 1/4 cup vegan, *, very finely chopped, 72% cacao or higher)
1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder (or finely ground hazelnuts, for coating, optional)
3/4 cup peanut butter cups (miniature Reese’s, quartered and frozen)
2 tablespoons grapeseed oil (though if you can do dairy, butter works just as well)
1 cup crumbled feta (I like a lot, some people prefer just a touch)
6 ounces jam (or so assorted, I used strawberry, blackberry & peach)
12 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
2 cups short grain brown rice (or medium grain)
2 tablespoons McCormick® Tangy Spice Blend, divided
2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste
1/4 cup butter (olive oil, or other oil will work as well; a butter/olive oil combination is very good too)
1 cup butter (best to use real butter)
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (1/8 cup per wrap)
8 ounces cream cheese (package, cut into 20 cubes)
1/2 cup vodka (Black vodka is even better)
10 ounces frozen spinach (chopped, thawed and drained)
5 ounces albacore tuna (I used Bumble Bee® Sundried Tomato with Olive Oil)
1/2 cup carrots (julienne cut, I took a short cut and used prepackaged matchstick cut)
1/2 cup baby spinach leaves (or similar greens)
6 cups strong coffee (I leave this preparation to your discretion. Generally, if making six cups, I use approximately 9-12)
2 -4 tablespoons milk or 2 -4 tablespoons fruit juice
1/3 cup agave (or honey if not vegan)
8 cups greens (mixed, such as mesclun or a mix of romaine and Boston and Bibb lettuces)
4 tablespoons hummus (Roasted Red Pepper, or your favorite hummus)
15 ounces black beans (rinsed and drained, you are only going to use about 1/2 the can)
2 teaspoons butter (oil works too) or 2 teaspoons margarine (oil works too)
2 cups broccoli, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 cup Chobani (® Whole Milk Plain Greek Yogurt)
2 tablespoons powdered sugar, or to taste
2 tablespoons olive oil or 2 tablespoons butter
3 cups vegetable broth or 3 cups chicken broth
3 tablespoons vermont grade b dark maple syrup
16 ounces fettucine (1 box , cooked and drained)
2 tablespoons Amaretto (or more depending on your preference)
6 ounces chocolate bar (dark, broken into pieces)
2 cups colby-monterey jack cheese or 2 cups cheddar cheese
16 ounces ground pork sausage (thaw if frozen)
2 cups Crystal Farms® Shredded Cheddar Cheese
1 cup salsa, jarred is OK, plus extra for garnish
2 cups chicken broth, like College Inn
4 tablespoons sour cream, recipe said dollops
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (you could sub other cheeses like mozzarella, fresh Parm, swiss, or pepper jack)
1 cup chopped ham (or cooked breakfast sausage)
2 teaspoons dried parsley (crushed in your hand or 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, minced)
1 cup cheddar cheese or 1 cup colby cheese, grated
2 cups Mexican blend cheese, shredded (or sharp cheddar)
1 cup unsalted butter (cut into small cubes)
2 teaspoons shredded cheese ({I used a cheddar-jack mix – you should experiment with any mild cheese you have on hand})
2 teaspoons vegetable oil (plus more for pan-frying)
3 cups leeks, washed very well and then thinly sliced (about 6 large, white and pale green parts only)
8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
2 cups fresh berries, divided (We love either blueberries or blackberries, but use any berries you like)
2 teaspoons kosher salt (plus more to taste)
2 cups asparagus, cut into 1-inch (2 1/2 cm) pieces
1 sheet spring roll pastry (cut into squares, 3x3 inches)
2 cups diced cooked ham (or deli slices)
1 cup fresh or thawed frozen blueberries
1 cup brewed espresso (could try strong coffee)
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (about half a small lemon)
2 cups chicken stock (I use 2 stock cubes and 2 cups hot water)
1 cup mayo (or more depending on preference)
1/2 cup tomato (seeds and pulp removed, chopped)
1/2 cup nuts (I used Pecans finely chopped)
6 ounces chicken stove top stuffing mix
10 ounces bittersweet chocolate or 10 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped into small pieces
1 cup dried cranberries (or other dried fruit or chopped nuts of your choice)
1/4 cup sunflower seed butter (or nut butter of your choice)
8 ounces lobster meat, torn into bite sized pieces
16 ounces whipped cream (Stabilized, or whipped topping)
1 cup milk (whole, or milk mixed with cream)
2 tablespoons sugar (adjust the sweetness to your taste but watch for burning.)
1 cup chopped Oreo cookies (or chopped Malted Milk Balls)
